lines: Hello, dear. I'm Marianne. So lovely to meet you.
Valentin's parties are always so refined and elegant.
I've been trying to get his erdbeerstrudel recipe for years, but he won't share it!
introduction.notebookNote: Marianne has been trying to get Valentin's recipe for years. Interested in his secrets?

lines: How absolutely dreadful! Poor Valentin must be devastated.
I was near the window, enjoying the view.
I certainly didn't see anyone tampering with the strudel.
followUpLines: This is such an unfortunate situation.
I do hope this gets resolved quickly.
Being trapped here is rather uncomfortable, don't you think?

lines: Oh, you found something? How clever of you.
I suppose we all have our little secrets, don't we?
I may have been a bit closer to the dessert table than I initially admitted...
followUpLines: I was merely admiring the presentation.
Valentin has such excellent taste in desserts.
postIncident.notebookNote: Marianne admits she was closer to the dessert table than she first said. Suspicious.

lines: Very well. I'll share what I know.
I saw Klaus near the strudel earlier. He seemed... contemplative. Perhaps even critical.
followUpLines: You know about their old rivalry, don't you?
Klaus has always been competitive with Valentin.
I'm just suggesting you keep that in mind.
postIncident.notebookNote: Marianne saw Klaus near the strudel looking critical. Pointing fingers or being helpful?

lines: You've discovered everything, haven't you? You're quite thorough.
I suppose honesty is the best policy now.
Yes, I took a slice. I couldn't help myself! But there was plenty left when I walked away.
followUpLines: I've wanted to taste it for so long...
But I only had one piece! Someone else must have eaten the rest.
You must believe me. I'm not entirely to blame here.
postIncident.notebookNote: Marianne confesses to taking a slice but insists she left plenty. Another partial confession?
